                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex16.m1.10.4">
                                      <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex16.m1.3"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex16.m1.4"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.Ex16.m1.3">0</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex16.m1.4">K</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
            </equation>
            <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}\leq\frac{1}{2}" text="C _ P less= 1 / 2" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then we choose <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta=\frac{1}{2}" text="beta = 1 / 2" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and obtain (<ref labelref="LABEL:A-coercivity"/>).
If <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}\geq\frac{1}{2}" text="C _ P &gt;= 1 / 2" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then
choosing <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta&gt;0" text="beta &gt; 0" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, such that <Math mode="inline" tex="1-2C_{P}+\beta=\frac{1}{2}" text="(1 - 2 * C _ P) + beta = 1 / 2" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, we derive
the lower bound for
<!--  %**** String Line 625 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{A}}}^{LS}({{\mathbf{v}}},q;{{\mathbf{v}}},q)" text="A ^ (L * S) * vector@(v, q, v, q)" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.1">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.2">q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.3">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m12.4">q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="(4C_{P}-1)/(4C_{P}+1)" text="(4 * C _ P - 1) / (4 * C _ P + 1)" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m13.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m13.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m13.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m13.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, which obviously is greater or equal to
<Math mode="inline" tex="\frac{1}{3}" text="1 / 3" xml:id="S2.SS3.SSS2.p3.m14">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Thus we have the desired bound (<ref labelref="LABEL:A-coercivity"/>).
∎</p>
          </para>
        </proof>
        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" xml:id="S2.Thmremark2">
          <tags>
            <tag>Remark 2.2</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 2.2</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 2.2</text></tag>.</title>
          <para xml:id="S2.Thmremark2.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">We stress that, under the assumption (<ref labelref="LABEL:bound_below_K"/>)
and the choice of the norms in the spaces <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{V}}}" text="V" xml:id="S2.Thmremark2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.Thmremark2.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>,
the coercivity constant of the bilinear form in the least-squares formulation
does not depend on the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S2.Thmremark2.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</text></p>
          </para>
        </theorem>
      </subsubsection>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:s:FEM" xml:id="S3">
    <tags>
      <tag>3</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§3</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">3</tag>FEM approximations</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">3</tag>FEM approximations</toctitle>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:ss:FE_spaces" xml:id="S3.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>3.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§3.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">3.1</tag>Finite element partitioning and spaces</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">3.1</tag>Finite element partitioning and spaces</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p1">
        <p>We assume that the domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is connected and is triangulated
with <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> dimensional simplices. The triangulation is denoted by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and we assume that the simplices forming
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are shape regular (the ratio between the diameter of a
simplex and the inscribed ball is bounded above).
Now we consider the finite element approximation of the problem
(<ref labelref="LABEL:equation-1"/>) – (<ref labelref="LABEL:N_BC"/>) using the finite dimensional
spaces <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}\subset{{\bm{V}}}" text="V _ h subset-of V" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="-0.6pt" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{h}\subset W" text="W _ h subset-of W" xml:id="S3.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of piece-wise polynomial functions.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p2">
        <p>It is well known that for the vector variable <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{u}}}" text="u" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we can use <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{H}}}({\operatorname{div}})" text="H * div" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p2.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m2.1">div</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-conforming
or Raviart-Thomas space <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{RT}}_{{k}}}" text="R * T _ k" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or Brezzi-Douglas-Marini <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{BDM}}_{{k+1}}}" text="B * D * M _ (k + 1)" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> finite elements.
<!--  %**** String Line 650 **** -->However, since we have a problem with low regularity it is natural to use the lowest order
finite element spaces. For the vector variable <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{u}}}" text="u" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we use the standard
Raviart-Thomas
<Math mode="inline" tex="\text{RT}_{0}" text="[RT] _ 0" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMText>RT</XMText>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for simplices and cubes. In the case of simplices we can apply
also Brezzi-Douglas-Marini
<Math mode="inline" tex="\text{BDM}_{1}" text="[BDM] _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMText>BDM</XMText>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> finite elements.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p3">
        <p>For the two formulations, least-squares and mixed, we use <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-conforming finite elements spaces for pressure <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note that for the least-squares formulation <Math mode="inline" tex="W=H^{1}_{D}(\Omega)" text="W = (H ^ 1) _ D * Omega" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p3.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m3.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> while for the mixed formulation <Math mode="inline" tex="W=L^{2}(\Omega)" text="W = L ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p3.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m4.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
For both cases we show that the corresponding finite element methods are stable uniformly with
respect to the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S3.SS1.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S3.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>3.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§3.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">3.2</tag>Mixed FEM and its stability</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">3.2</tag>Mixed FEM and its stability</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS2.p1">
        <p>Thus,
we take</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:space_Vh" xml:id="S3.E1">

(<ref labelref="LABEL:A-form-mixed"/>).
Our goal is to prove the discrete variant of the <text font="italic">inf-sup</text> condition.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lemma" inlist="thm theorem:lemma" labels="LABEL:lem:stab_fin" xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Lemma 3.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 3.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 3.1</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}" text="V _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="-0.6pt" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be the space defined by (<ref labelref="LABEL:space_Vh"/>) and <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{h}" text="W _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be the space defined by
(<ref labelref="LABEL:space_Wh"/>).
Then independently of the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and the step-size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S3.Thmlemma1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
the following inequality holds true:</text></p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:inf_sup_fin_set" xml:id="S3.E4">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3.4)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3.4</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="\inf_{q_{h}\in W_{h}}\sup_{{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h}\in{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}%&#10;}}\frac{({\operatorname{div}}{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h},q_{h})}{\|{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h}\|%&#10;_{\Lambda_{{\alpha}}}\|q_{h}\|}\geq\gamma&gt;0." text="(infimum _ (q _ h element-of W _ h))@((supremum _ (v _ h element-of V _ h))@(open-interval@(div@(v _ h), q _ h) / ((norm@(v _ h)) _ Lambda _ alpha * norm@(q _ h)))) &gt;= gamma &gt; 0" xml:id="S3.E4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.E4.m1.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.E4.m1.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">inf</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok font="bold" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" lpadding="-0.6pt" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.E4.m1.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.E4.m1.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S3.E4.m1.1">
                                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">div</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S3.E4.m1.2">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S3.E4.m1.3"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.E4.m1.3">
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.E4.m1.4"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.E4.m1.4">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN">γ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.SS2.p2">
          <p>This is stated and proved as Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:theorem:inf-sup"/> in the
Appendix.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS2.p3">
        <p>As a consequence of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem:stab_fin"/> and (<ref labelref="LABEL:continuity"/>) we have</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:DM_stability" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 3.1</tag>

          <p><text font="italic">The following bounds are valid for all <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{u}}}\in{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}" text="u element-of V _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>

              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">The constant <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha_{0}" text="alpha _ 0" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> may depend on the shape regularity of the
mesh, but is independent of the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and the mesh-size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem1.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S3.SS3">
      <tags>
        <tag>3.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§3.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">3.3</tag>Least-squares FEM and its stability</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">3.3</tag>Least-squares FEM and its stability</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS3.p1">
        <p>For the least-squares formulation the space <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{h}" text="W _ h" xml:id="S3.SS3.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for the pressure <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S3.SS3.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
consists of standard conforming Lagrangian
finite elements involving linear polynomials <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}_{1}" text="P _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS3.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (on triangles)
and bilinear polynomials <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{Q}}_{1}" text="Q _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS3.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (on rectangles).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS3.p2">
        <p>Since in this case we have conforming spaces, then the results of Lemma
<ref labelref="LABEL:lem:stab_var_LS"/> are valid so that finite element method is stable. Thus we have</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_theorem" inlist="thm theorem:theorem" labels="LABEL:LS_stability" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 3.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 3.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 3.2</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The bilinear form <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{A}}}^{LS}({{\mathbf{u}}},p;{{\mathbf{v}}},q)" text="A ^ (L * S) * vector@(u, p, v, q)" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.1">u</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.2">p</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.3">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m1.4">q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is coercive and bounded on <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}\times W_{h}" text="V _ h * W _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
so that the following bounds are valid for all <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{v}}}\in{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}" text="v element-of V _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" lpadding="-0.6pt" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="q\in W_{h}" text="q element-of W _ h" xml:id="S3.Thmtheorem2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>:</text></p>

          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">and</text></p>

            <tags>
              <tag>(3.7)</tag>

            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="{{\mathcal{A}}}^{LS}({{\mathbf{u}}},p;{{\mathbf{v}}},q)\leq 2(\|{{\mathbf{u}}}%&#10;\|^{2}_{\Lambda_{{\alpha}}}+\|p\|^{2}_{1,K})^{\frac{1}{2}}(\|{{\mathbf{v}}}\|^%&#10;{2}_{\Lambda_{{\alpha}}}+\|q\|^{2}_{1,K})^{\frac{1}{2}}." text="A ^ (L * S) * vector@(u, p, v, q) less= 2 * (((norm@(u)) ^ 2) _ Lambda _ alpha + ((norm@(p)) ^ 2) _ (list@(1, K))) ^ (1 / 2) * (((norm@(v)) ^ 2) _ Lambda _ alpha + ((norm@(q)) ^ 2) _ (list@(1, K))) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S3.E7.m1">

                                        <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>

                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.E7.m1.3">1</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E7.m1.4">K</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS3.p3">
        <p>We note that the coercivity and the stability of the
least-squares FEM immediately show that we have an efficient preconditioner
for this problem as long as we know how to solve an weighted <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{H}}}({\operatorname{div}})" text="H * div" xml:id="S3.SS3.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.SS3.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.SS3.p3.m1.1">div</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
problem and also a scalar elliptic problem. Moreover, since the
stiffness matrix resulting from the least-squares FEM
is an SPD matrix, such a preconditioner can be used
in the conjugate gradient algorithm to obtain an efficient and optimal
solution method.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:s:precon" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§4</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">4</tag>Preconditioning</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">4</tag>Preconditioning</toctitle>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:b-diag-operator" xml:id="S4.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">4.1</tag>Block-diagonal preconditioner for the system of the finite element method</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.1</tag>Block-diagonal preconditioner for the system of the finite element method</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p1">
        <p>Now we consider the problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>) and for definiteness
we restrict ourselves to the lowest order Raviart-Thomas mixed finite
elements on a rectangular grid. The goal of this section is to develop
and justify a preconditioner for the algebraic problem resulting from
the Galerkin method (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>) that is independent of the
contrast of the media.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p2">
        <p>Then (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>) can be written as an operator equation in <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{h}={{\bm{V}}}_{h}\times W_{h}" text="X _ h = V _ h * W _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Namely, for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bm{x}}_{h}=({{\mathbf{u}}}_{h},p_{h})" text="x _ h = open-interval@(u _ h, p _ h)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p2.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p2.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we have

                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Obviously, the operator <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{A}_{h}:X_{h}\rightarrow X_{h}^{\star}" text="A _ h colon X _ h rightarrow (X _ h) ^ star" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="star" role="MULOP">⋆</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is self-adjoint
on <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{h}={{\bm{V}}}_{h}\times W_{h}" text="X _ h = V _ h * W _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and indefinite in the case of
dual mixed formulation and positive definite in the case of least-squares approximation.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p3">
        <p>As it has been shown in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="1991BrezziF_FortinM-aa" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the operator norms
corresponding to the mixed finite element disretization (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>)</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:operator_norms" xml:id="S4.E2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4.2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
          </tags>

                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.E2.m1.4">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>The same is valid for the operator norms corresponding to the least squares formulation.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p4">
        <p>Now our goal is to construct a positive definite self-adjoint operator

          </Math> such that all eigenvalues of

uniformly independent of <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m3">

            <XMath>

            </XMath>
          </Math>. From (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:operator_norms"/>) it follows that</p>

        <p>is sufficient for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{B}_{h}" text="B _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to be a uniform and robust
preconditioner for the minimum residual (MinRes) iteration for the
mixed method and conjugate gradient (CG) for the least-squares
method.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p5">
        <p>Let the block-diagonal preconditioner <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{B}_{h}" text="B _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m1">

              </XMApp>

        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{h}:\,{{\bm{V}}}_{h}\rightarrow{{\bm{V}}}_{h}^{*}" text="A _ h colon V _ h rightarrow (V _ h) ^ *" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is given by</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex2">
          <Math mode="display" tex="(A_{h}{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h},{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h}):=\Lambda_{{\alpha}}({{\mathbf{u}}%&#10;}_{h},{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h})=({{\alpha}}\,{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h},{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h})+%&#10;(\nabla\cdot{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h},\nabla\cdot{{\mathbf{v}}}_{h})" text="open-interval@(A _ h * u _ h, v _ h) assign Lambda _ alpha * open-interval@(u _ h, v _ h) = open-interval@(alpha * u _ h, v _ h) + open-interval@(nabla cdot u _ h, nabla cdot v _ h)" xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1">

                    <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.5"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.6"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">α</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.6">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.7"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex2.m1.8"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.7">
                        <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>

                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex2.m1.8">

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>and <Math mode="inline" tex="D_{h}:~{}W_{h}\to W_{h}^{*}" text="D _ h colon W _ h to (W _ h) ^ *" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="3.3pt">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is either <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{h}" text="I _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the identity on <Math mode="inline" tex="W_{h}" text="W _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (for the mixed method) or
is defined by the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="(D_{h}p_{h},q_{h})=(K\nabla p_{h},\nabla q_{h})" text="open-interval@(D _ h * p _ h, q _ h) = open-interval@(K * nabla@(p _ h), nabla@(q _ h))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m6.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m6.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m6.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m6.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m6.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m6.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for the least-squares
finite element method.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" labels="LABEL:iterations" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Remark 4.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 4.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 4.1</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">As easily seen, preconditioning is an equivalence relation,</text></p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2">
          <p><text font="italic">that is, if
<Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{1}\eqsim Z_{2}" text="Z _ 1 eqsim Z _ 2" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="eqsim" role="RELOP">≂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{2}\eqsim Z_{3}" text="Z _ 2 eqsim Z _ 3" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="eqsim" role="RELOP">≂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for some operators <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{1}" text="Z _ 1" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{2}" text="Z _ 2" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{3}" text="Z _ 3" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="Z_{1}\eqsim Z_{3}" text="Z _ 1 eqsim Z _ 3" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="eqsim" role="RELOP">≂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Therefore, uniform condition
number estimates for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{B}_{h}" text="B _ h" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, directly carry over to the
case when <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{B}_{h}" text="B _ h" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is replaced by any of its uniform (with
respect to the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and with respect to the mesh size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.Thmremark1.p2.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>) preconditioners.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p6">
        <p>Then condition (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:precond_norms"/>) reduces to <Math mode="inline" tex="\|A_{h}\|_{\mathcal{L}({{\bm{V}}}_{h},{{\bm{V}}}_{h}^{\star})}" text="(norm@(A _ h)) _ (L * open-interval@(V _ h, (V _ h) ^ star))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
