                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m1.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m1.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m1.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="star" role="MULOP">⋆</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\|A_{h}^{-1}\|_{\mathcal{L}({{\bm{V}}}_{h}^{\star},{{\bm{V}}}_{h})}" text="(norm@((A _ h) ^ (- 1))) _ (L * open-interval@((V _ h) ^ star, V _ h))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m2.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m2.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m2.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="star" role="MULOP">⋆</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m2.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="bold italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> being uniformly
bounded in <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which in the case of the mixed method is
sufficient for optimality of the preconditioner,
see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Arnold1997preconditioning" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. For the case of the least-squares
formulation  (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:precond_norms"/>) we also need uniform boundedness
<!--  %**** String Line 825 **** -->of <Math mode="inline" tex="\|D_{h}\|_{\mathcal{L}(W_{h},W_{h}^{\star})}" text="(norm@(D _ h)) _ (L * open-interval@(W _ h, (W _ h) ^ star))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m5.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m5.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m5.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m5.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m5.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="star" role="MULOP">⋆</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\|D_{h}^{-1}\|_{\mathcal{L}(W_{h}^{\star},W_{h})}" text="(norm@((D _ h) ^ (- 1))) _ (L * open-interval@((W _ h) ^ star, W _ h))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m6.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m6.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p6.m6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m6.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="star" role="MULOP">⋆</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m6.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Optimal
preconditioners using multigrid and domain decomposition methods for
solving the system
<Math mode="inline" tex="D_{h}p_{h}=c_{h}" text="D _ h * p _ h = c _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
have been developed by many authors
in the last three decades. One approach for the solution of
<Math mode="inline" tex="D_{h}p_{h}=c_{h}" text="D _ h * p _ h = c _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
(which is, in some sense, the closest one to our work)
is the multilevel and auxiliary space multigrid methods proposed
in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kraus_12,Kraus_Lymb_Mar_2014" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p7">
        <p>Thus, the main task in this section is the development and study of
a robust and uniformly convergent (with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S4.SS1.p7.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)
iterative method for solving systems with
<Math mode="inline" tex="A_{h}{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h}={{\mathbf{b}}}_{h}" text="A _ h * u _ h = b _ h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p7.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:matrix-notation" xml:id="S4.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">4.2</tag>Reformulation of the FE problem using matrix notation</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.2</tag>Reformulation of the FE problem using matrix notation</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p1">
        <p>The derivation and the justification of the
preconditioner
will be in the
framework of algebraic multilevel/multigrid methods. As a first step
we rewrite the operator equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:mixed-operator"/>) in a matrix
form. For doing this, instead of functions <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bm{x}}_{h}=({{\mathbf{u}}}_{h},p_{h})\in{{\bm{V}}}_{h}\times W_{h}" text="x _ h = open-interval@(u _ h, p _ h) element-of V _ h * W _ h" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 850 **** -->                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we use the vectors consisting of the
degrees of freedom determining <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bm{x}}_{h}" text="x _ h" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
through the nodal basis functions, namely,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\bm{x}}=\left[\begin{array}[]{c}{\bf u}\\&#10;{\bf p}\end{array}\right],\quad\mbox{where}\quad\quad{\bf u}\in\mathbb{R}^{|%&#10;\mathcal{E}_{h}|},\quad{\bf p}\in\mathbb{R}^{|\mathcal{T}_{h}|},\quad\mbox{are%&#10; vector columns}" text="formulae@(x = list@(delimited-[]@(Array[[u], [p]]), [where]), formulae@(u element-of R ^ (absolute-value@(E _ h)), p element-of list@(R ^ (absolute-value@(T _ h)), [are vector columns])))" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.6"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.6">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">[</XMTok>

                              <XMRow>

                                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>

                                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                        <XMText xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.5">where</XMText>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="qquad" role="PUNCT">  </XMTok>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.7">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.7.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.7.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.7.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.1"/>
                            </XMApp>

                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          </XMDual>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.7.2">

                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.7.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.4"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.7.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>

                                </XMApp>

                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.2">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                            <XMText xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.4">are vector columns</XMText>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>and <Math mode="inline" tex="{|\mathcal{E}_{h}|}" text="absolute-value@(E _ h)" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m3.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the number of edges in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{E}_{h}" text="E _ h" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, excluding those
on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{N}" text="Gamma _ N" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="{|\mathcal{T}_{h}|}" text="absolute-value@(T _ h)" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m6.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m6.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the number of
rectangles of the partition <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{B_{\operatorname{div}}}" text="B _ div" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">div</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}" text="widetilde@(A)" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, denote matrices being either square or
rectangular. As a result of this convention
the equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:mixed-operator"/>) can be written in a matrix form
for mixed and least-squares approximations, correspondingly,</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p2">
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys" xml:id="S4.E5">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4.5)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.5</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}{{M}_{{\alpha}}}&amp;-{B_{\operatorname{div}}}^{T}\\&#10;-{B_{\operatorname{div}}}&amp;0\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}[]{c}{\bf u}\\&#10;{\bf p}\end{array}\right]=\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\bf{0}\\&#10;\bf{f}\end{array}\right],\quad\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}A&amp;{B_{\operatorname{div%&#10;}}}^{T}\\&#10;{B_{\operatorname{div}}}&amp;D\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}[]{c}{\bf u}\\&#10;{\bf p}\end{array}\right]=\left[\begin{array}[]{c}\bf{0}\\&#10;\bf{f}\end{array}\right]," text="formulae@(delimited-[]@(Array[[M _ alpha, - (B _ div) ^ T], [- B _ div, 0]]) * delimited-[]@(Array[[u], [p]]) = delimited-[]@(Array[[0], [f]]), delimited-[]@(Array[[A, (B _ div) ^ T], [B _ div, D]]) * delimited-[]@(Array[[u], [p]]) = delimited-[]@(Array[[0], [f]]))" xml:id="S4.E5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.E5.m1.7"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S4.E5.m1.7">
                    <XMApp>

Our aim now is to derive and study a preconditioner for the algebraic system
(<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>), which due to the above considerations reduces
to efficient preconditioning of
the system</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:algebraic-hdiv" xml:id="S4.E6">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4.6)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.6</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="A{{\mathbf{u}}}={{\mathbf{b}}},\quad{{\mathbf{u}}},{{\mathbf{b}}}\in\mathbb{R}%&#10;^{N},\quad N:={|\mathcal{E}_{h}|}." text="formulae@(A * u = list@(b, u), formulae@(b element-of R ^ N, N assign absolute-value@(E _ h)))" xml:id="S4.E6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E6.m1.1">b</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E6.m1.2">u</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3.2.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3.2.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3.2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3.2.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S4.E6.m1.3.2.2.1"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S4.E6.m1.3.2.2.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 925 **** -->                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:robust-H_div-precond" xml:id="S4.SS3">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">4.3</tag>Robust preconditioning of the weighted <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{H}}}({\operatorname{div}})" text="H * div" xml:id="S4.SS3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S4.SS3.m1.1">div</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-norm</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.3</tag>Robust preconditioning of the weighted <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{H}}}({\operatorname{div}})" text="H * div" xml:id="S4.SS3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S4.SS3.m2.1">div</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-norm</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS3.p1">
        <p>The preconditioning technique described in this section is based on additive Schur complement
approximation (ASCA), see, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kraus_12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. For the sake of self-containedness, first we will
recall the auxiliary space two-grid and multigrid methods that have recently been introduced
in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kraus_Lymb_Mar_2014" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Then we formulate two variants of the algorithm
resulting from ASCA that are subject to
numerical testing in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:sec:numerics"/>.</p>
      </para>
      <subsubsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:as-2-grid-precond" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1">
        <tags>
          <tag>4.3.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">4.3.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">§4.3.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title><tag close=". ">4.3.1</tag>Auxiliary space two-grid preconditioner</title>
        <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.3.1</tag>Auxiliary space two-grid preconditioner</toctitle>
        <para xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1">
          <p>The first step in the construction of the preconditioner involves a covering
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> overlapping subdomains <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega_{i}" text="Omega _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, i.e.,</p>
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex4">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\overline{\Omega}=\bigcup_{i=1}^{n}\overline{\Omega}_{i}." text="overline@(Omega) = ((union _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((overline@(Omega)) _ i)" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                          <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="display" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">⋃</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>This overlapping covering of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is to some
extent
arbitrary with generous overlap.
For practical purposes however, we consider the situation shown on Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:covering"/>.
In this particular case any finite element in the partition <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
will belong to no more than four subdomains.
We associate subdomain matrices <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{i}" text="A _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
<!--  %**** String Line 950 **** --><Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\dots,n" text="i = list@(1, dots, n)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m7.3">n</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with the subdomains <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega_{i}" text="Omega _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and assume that
they have the following assembling property</p>
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex5">
            <Math mode="display" tex="A=\sum_{i=1}^{n}R_{{i}}^{T}A_{{i}}R_{{i}}," text="A = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R _ i) ^ T * A _ i * R _ i)" xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex5.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                          <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{i}" text="R _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a rectangular matrix that extends by zero the vector associated with the
degrees of freedom of <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h}" text="u _ h" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega_{i}" text="Omega _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> to a vector representing the degrees of
freedom in the whole domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
Assume further that the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{D}" text="D" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of degrees of freedom (DOF) of <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{u}}}_{h}" text="u _ h" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
is partitioned into a set <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{D}_{\rm f}" text="D _ f" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, fine DOF, and a set
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{D}_{\rm c}" text="D _ c" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, coarse DOF, so that</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:eq:partitioning_DOF" xml:id="S4.E7">
            <tags>
              <tag>(4.7)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">4.7</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="\mathcal{D}=\mathcal{D}_{\rm f}\oplus\mathcal{D}_{\rm c}," text="D = D _ f direct-sum D _ c" xml:id="S4.E7.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.E7.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.E7.m1.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="direct-sum" name="oplus" role="ADDOP">⊕</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="N_{1}:=|\mathcal{D}_{\rm f}|" text="N _ 1 assign absolute-value@(D _ f)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m17">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>

              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="N_{2}:=|\mathcal{D}_{\rm c}|" text="N _ 2 assign absolute-value@(D _ c)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m18">
              <XMath>

              </XMath>
            </Math>
denote the cardinalities of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{D}_{\rm f}" text="D _ f" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m19">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{D}_{\rm c}" text="D _ c" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m20">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, respectively,
with <Math mode="inline" tex="N_{1}+N_{2}=N:=|{\mathcal{E}}_{h}|" text="N _ 1 + N _ 2 = N assign absolute-value@(E _ h)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m21">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m21.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m21.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Recall that <Math mode="inline" tex="|{\mathcal{E}}_{h}|" text="absolute-value@(E _ h)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m22">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m22.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m22.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
is the number of edges in the partitioning <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m23">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with the
edges on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{N}" text="Gamma _ N" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m24">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> excluded.
Such splitting is not obvious for the mixed finite element
method and will be explained in detail later.
The splitting
(<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:partitioning_DOF"/>) induces a representation of the matrices <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m25">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="A_{i}" text="A _ i" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m26">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> into two-by-two block form, i.e.,</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:eq:A_two_by_two-x" xml:id="S4.E8">
            <tags>
              <tag>(4.8)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">4.8</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="A=\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}A_{11}&amp;A_{12}\\&#10;A_{21}&amp;A_{22}\end{array}\right],\qquad A_{i}=\left[\begin{array}[]{cc}A_{i:11}%&#10;&amp;A_{i:12}\\&#10;A_{i:21}&amp;A_{i:22}\end{array}\right],\quad i=1,\dots,n." text="formulae@(A = delimited-[]@(Array[[A _ 11, A _ 12], [A _ 21, A _ 22]]), formulae@(A _ i = delimited-[]@(Array[[A _ (i colon 11), A _ (i colon 12)], [A _ (i colon 21), A _ (i colon 22)]]), i = list@(1, dots, n)))" xml:id="S4.E8.m1">
              <XMath>

          <p>We now introduce the following auxiliary domain decomposition matrix</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:eq:auxA" xml:id="S4.E9">
            <tags>
              <tag>(4.9)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">4.9</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="\widetilde{A}=\left[\begin{array}[]{ccccc}A_{1:11}&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;A_{1:12}R_{1:2}\\&#10;&amp;A_{2:11}&amp;&amp;&amp;A_{2:12}R_{2:2}\\&#10;&amp;&amp;\ddots&amp;&amp;\vdots\\&#10;&amp;&amp;&amp;A_{{n}:11}&amp;A_{{n}:12}R_{n:2}\\&#10;R_{1:2}^{T}A_{1:21}&amp;R_{2:2}^{T}A_{2:21}&amp;\ldots&amp;R^{T}_{n:2}A_{{n}:21}&amp;%&#10;\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{n}R^{T}_{i:2}A_{i:22}R_{i:2}\end{array}\right]," text="widetilde@(A) = delimited-[]@(Array[[A _ (1 colon 11), , , , A _ (1 colon 12) * R _ (1 colon 2)], [, A _ (2 colon 11), , , A _ (2 colon 12) * R _ (2 colon 2)], [, , ddots, , vdots], [, , , A _ (n colon 11), A _ (n colon 12) * R _ (n colon 2)], [(R _ (1 colon 2)) ^ T * A _ (1 colon 21), (R _ (2 colon 2)) ^ T * A _ (2 colon 21), ldots, (R ^ T) _ (n colon 2) * A _ (n colon 21), ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R ^ T) _ (i colon 2) * A _ (i colon 22) * R _ (i colon 2))]])" xml:id="S4.E9.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.E9.m1.2"/>

                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="22" role="NUMBER">22</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMCell>
                            </XMRow>
                          </XMArray>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">]</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 1000 **** -->                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>Setting
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}_{11}={\rm diag}\{A_{1:11},\ldots,A_{{n}:11}\}" text="(widetilde@(A)) _ 11 = diag * set@(A _ (1 colon 11), ldots, A _ (n colon 11))" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">diag</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.1">…</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m27.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}_{22}=\sum_{i=1}^{n}R^{T}_{i:2}A_{i:22}R_{i:2}" text="(widetilde@(A)) _ 22 = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R ^ T) _ (i colon 2) * A _ (i colon 22) * R _ (i colon 2))" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m28">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>

                      <XMApp>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>

                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> we have</p>

          <p>Note that if <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m29">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is an SPD matrix then <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}" text="widetilde@(A)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m30">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a symmetric and positive semi-definite matrix.
Moreover, <Math mode="inline" tex="A\in{{\mathbb{R}}^{{N{\times}N}}}" text="A element-of R ^ (N * N)" xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS1.p1.m31">

              </XMath>
            </Math> and

are related via</p>

        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_definition" inlist="thm theorem:definition" xml:id="S4.Thmdefinition1">
          <tags>
            <tag>Definition 4.1</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 4.1</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 4.1</text></tag> (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kraus_12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).</title>
          <para xml:id="S4.Thmdefinition1.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">The additive Schur complement approximation (ASCA) of the exact Schur complement
<Math mode="inline" tex="S=A_{22}-A_{21}A_{11}^{-1}A_{12}" text="S = A _ 22 - A _ 21 * (A _ 11) ^ (- 1) * A _ 12" xml:id="S4.Thmdefinition1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="22" role="NUMBER">22</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="21" role="NUMBER">21</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S4.Thmdefinition1.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and defined as the
Schur complement of
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}" text="widetilde@(A)" xml:id="S4.Thmdefinition1.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, i.e.,</text></p>
            <equation xml:id="S4.Ex6">
              <Math mode="display" tex="Q:=\widetilde{A}_{22}-\widetilde{A}_{21}\widetilde{A}_{11}^{-1}\widetilde{A}_{%&#10;12}=\sum_{i=1}^{n}R_{{i}:2}^{T}(A_{{i}:22}-A_{{i}:21}A_{{i}:11}^{-1}A_{{i}:12}%&#10;)R_{{i}:2}." text="Q assign (widetilde@(A)) _ 22 - (widetilde@(A)) _ 21 * ((widetilde@(A)) _ 11) ^ (- 1) * (widetilde@(A)) _ 12 = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R _ (i colon 2)) ^ T * (A _ (i colon 22) - A _ (i colon 21) * (A _ (i colon 11)) ^ (- 1) * A _ (i colon 12)) * R _ (i colon 2))" xml:id="S4.Ex6.m1">
                <XMath>
