                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td align="left" thead="row">Post-smoothing:</td>
                      <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="(\widehat{B}^{(k)})^{-1}[\widehat{{{\bf{{d}}}}}]:=\widehat{{{\bf{{v}}}}}+(%&#10;\widehat{M}^{(k)})^{-T}(\widehat{{{\bf{{d}}}}}-\widehat{A}^{(k)}\widehat{{{\bf%&#10;{{v}}}}})" text="(widehat@(B)) ^ k ^ (- 1) * delimited-[]@(widehat@(d)) assign widehat@(v) + (widehat@(M)) ^ k ^ (- T) * (widehat@(d) - (widehat@(A)) ^ k * widehat@(v))" xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm1.p1.m4">
                          <XMath>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMRef idref="S4.Thmalgorithm1.p1.m4.5"/>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm1.p1.m4.5">
                                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                        <XMApp>

<rule height="1px" width="100%"/></text></p>
          </para>
        </theorem>
        <para xml:id="S4.SS3.SSS3.p9">
          <p>The second algorithm applies the nonlinear ASMG method directly in the original basis of
<!--  %**** String Line 1375 **** -->standard Raviart-Thomas basis functions and reads as follows.</p>
        </para>
        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_algorithm" inlist="thm theorem:algorithm" labels="LABEL:algorithm2" xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm2">
          <tags>
            <tag>Algorithm 4.2</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Algorithm 4.2</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Algorithm 4.2</text></tag>.</title>
          <para xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm2.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">Nonlinear ASMG method–Variant II: Action of (<ref labelref="LABEL:multigrid_preconditioner"/>)
on a vector <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bf{{d}}}}" text="d" xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="bold upright" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> <break/>

                  <tbody>

                      <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="{B^{(k)}}^{-1}[{{\bf{{d}}}}]:={{\bf{{v}}}}+{M^{(k)}}^{-T}({{\bf{{d}}}}-A^{(k)}%&#10;{{\bf{{v}}}})" text="B ^ k ^ (- 1) * delimited-[]@(d) assign v + M ^ k ^ (- T) * (d - A ^ k * v)" xml:id="S4.Thmalgorithm2.p1.m4">

        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4">
          <tags>
            <tag>Remark 4.4</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.4</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 4.4</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 4.4</text></tag>.</title>
          <para xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">Note that the matrices <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}^{(k)}_{11}" text="((widetilde@(A)) ^ k) _ 11" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}^{(k)}_{12}" text="((widetilde@(A)) ^ k) _ 12" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m2.1">k</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{A}^{(k)}_{21}" text="((widetilde@(A)) ^ k) _ 21" xml:id="S4.Thmremark4.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </Math> are identical in both algorithms.</text></p>
          </para>
        </theorem>
<!--  %**** String Line 1400 **** -->        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" xml:id="S4.Thmremark5">
          <tags>
            <tag>Remark 4.5</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.5</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 4.5</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 4.5</text></tag>.</title>
          <para xml:id="S4.Thmremark5.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">In general the matrices <Math mode="inline" tex="\widehat{A}^{(k)}" text="(widehat@(A)) ^ k" xml:id="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> have slightly
more nonzero entries as compared to <Math mode="inline" tex="A^{(k)}" text="A ^ k" xml:id="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmremark5.p1.m2.1">k</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and thus Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>
increases computational memory requirements.</text></p>
          </para>
        </theorem>
        <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6">
          <tags>
            <tag>Remark 4.6</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.6</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 4.6</tag>
          </tags>
          <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 4.6</text></tag>.</title>
          <para xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">Considering the two-level preconditioners <Math mode="inline" tex="\widehat{B}" text="widehat@(B)" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="B" text="B" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> defined according
to Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> and Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>, and assuming that no
smoothing is performed, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="\widehat{M}=M=0" text="widehat@(M) = M = 0" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, the corresponding condition number
bounds for the preconditioned operators in two-level basis and standard basis read
<Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa(\widehat{B}^{-1}\widehat{A})\leq\|R^{T}\Pi_{\widetilde{D}}\|^{2}_{%&#10;\widetilde{A}}" text="kappa * (widehat@(B)) ^ (- 1) * widehat@(A) less= ((norm@(R ^ T * Pi _ (widetilde@(D)))) ^ 2) _ (widetilde@(A))" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m4.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m4.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m4.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m4.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa(B^{-1}A)\leq\|R^{T}J\,\Pi_{\widetilde{D}}\|^{2}_{\widetilde{A}}" text="kappa * B ^ (- 1) * A less= ((norm@(R ^ T * J * Pi _ (widetilde@(D)))) ^ 2) _ (widetilde@(A))" xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m5.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m5.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m5.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmremark6.p1.m5.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">J</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</text></p>
          </para>
        </theorem>
      </subsubsection>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:numerics" xml:id="S5">
    <tags>
      <tag>5</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§5</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">5</tag>Numerical Experiments</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">5</tag>Numerical Experiments</toctitle>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S5.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">5.1</tag>Description of the parameters and the numerical test examples</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">5.1</tag>Description of the parameters and the numerical test examples</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p1">
        <p>Subject to numerical testing are three representative cases of problems characterized by a highly
varying coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\alpha}}(x)=K^{-1}(x)" text="alpha * x = K ^ (- 1) * x" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p1.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p1.m1.2">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, namely:</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S5.I1">
          <item xml:id="S5.I1.ix1">
            <tags>
              <tag>[a</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item [a</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I1.ix1.p1">
              <p>] A binary distribution of the coefficient described by islands on which
<Math mode="inline" tex="{{\alpha}}=1.0" text="alpha = 1.0" xml:id="S5.I1.ix1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1.0" role="NUMBER">1.0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> against a background where <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\alpha}}=10^{-q}" text="alpha = 10 ^ (- q)" xml:id="S5.I1.ix1.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, see Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:islands_binary"/>;
<!--  %**** String Line 1425 **** --></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I1.ix2">
            <tags>
              <tag>[b</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item [b</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1">
              <p>] Inclusions with <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\alpha}}=1.0" text="alpha = 1.0" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1.0" role="NUMBER">1.0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and a background with a coefficient
<Math mode="inline" tex="{{\alpha}}={{\alpha}}_{T}=10^{-q_{rand}}" text="alpha = alpha _ T = 10 ^ (- q _ (r * a * n * d))" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> that is constant on each element <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau\in{\mathcal{T}}_{h}" text="tau element-of T _ h" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>,
where the random integer exponent <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{rand}\in\{0,1,2,\dots,q\}" text="q _ (r * a * n * d) element-of set@(0, 1, 2, dots, q)" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.2"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.3"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.4"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.5"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.1">0</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.2">1</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.3">2</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.4">…</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.I1.ix2.p1.m4.5">q</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is uniformly distributed,
see Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:islands_random"/>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I1.ix3">
            <tags>
              <tag>[c</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item [c</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I1.ix3.p1">
              <p>] Three two-dimensional slices of the SPE10
(Society of Petroleum Engineers)
benchmark problem, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="SPE10_project" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>,
where the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S5.I1.ix3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{7}" text="10 ^ 7" xml:id="S5.I1.ix3.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="7" role="NUMBER">7</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> for slices 44 and 74 and <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{6}" text="10 ^ 6" xml:id="S5.I1.ix3.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="6" role="NUMBER">6</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> for slice 54,
see Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:spe_10"/>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
      <figure inlist="lof" labels="LABEL:fig:islands_binary" placement="hb" xml:id="S5.F2">

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math><text fontsize="80%"> mesh</text></caption>
        </figure>

            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>

                <XMTok meaning="128" role="NUMBER">128</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> mesh</caption>
      </figure>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p2">
        <p>The numerical experiments are performed over a uniform mesh consisting of <Math mode="inline" tex="N{\times}N" text="N * N" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> elements (squares)
where <Math mode="inline" tex="N=4,8,\ldots,512" text="N = list@(4, 8, ldots, 512)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m2.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m2.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m2.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2.1">4</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="8" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2.2">8</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2.3">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="512" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m2.4">512</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, i.e. up to <Math mode="inline" tex="525312" text="525312" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="525312" role="NUMBER">525312</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> velocity DOF and <Math mode="inline" tex="262144" text="262144" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="262144" role="NUMBER">262144</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> pressure DOF.
We have used a direct method to solve the problems on the coarsest grid.
The iterative process has been initialized with a random vector.
Its convergence has been tested for linear systems with right-hand side zero.
We have used overlapping coverings of the domain as shown in Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:covering"/>,
where the subdomains are composed of <Math mode="inline" tex="8\times 8" text="8 * 8" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> elements and overlap with half of their
width/height.
In the presentation of results we use the following notations:
<!--  %**** String Line 1500 **** --></p>
        <itemize xml:id="S5.I2">
          <item xml:id="S5.I2.i1">
            <tags>
              <tag>•</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">1st item</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I2.i1.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\ell" text="ell" xml:id="S5.I2.i1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> denotes the number of levels;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I2.i2">
            <tags>
              <tag>•</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">2nd item</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I2.i2.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="q=\frac{\log\kappa}{\log 10}" text="q = logarithm@(kappa) / logarithm@(10)" xml:id="S5.I2.i2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is the logarithm of the contrast <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa" text="kappa" xml:id="S5.I2.i2.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I2.i3">
            <tags>
              <tag>•</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">3rd item</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I2.i3.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.I2.i3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is the number of auxiliary space multigrid iterations;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I2.i4">
            <tags>
              <tag>•</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">4th item</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I2.i4.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="m\geq 0" text="m &gt;= 0" xml:id="S5.I2.i4.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is the number of
point Gauss-Seidel pre- and post-smoothing steps;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S5.I2.i5">
            <tags>
              <tag>•</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">5th item</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S5.I2.i5.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="S5.I2.i5.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is the average convergence factor defined by</p>
              <equation labels="LABEL:eq:average_factor" xml:id="S5.E1">
                <tags>
                  <tag>(5.1)</tag>
                  <tag role="refnum">5.1</tag>
                </tags>
                <Math mode="display" tex="\rho=\Bigg{(}\frac{\|u_{n_{ASMG}}\|}{\|u_{0}\|}\Bigg{)}^{1/n_{ASMG}}," text="rho = (norm@(u _ n _ (A * S * M * G)) / norm@(u _ 0)) ^ (1 / n _ (A * S * M * G))" xml:id="S5.E1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.E1.m1.4"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.E1.m1.4">
                          <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.E1.m1.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok fontsize="260%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.E1.m1.3">
                                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S5.E1.m1.1"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.E1.m1.1">
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                          <XMApp>
                                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>

                                          </XMApp>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S5.E1.m1.2"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.E1.m1.2">
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="260%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
              </equation>
              <p>where
<Math mode="inline" tex="u_{n_{ASMG}}" text="u _ n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.I2.i5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> is the
first iterate (approximate solution of (<ref labelref="LABEL:algebraic-hdiv"/>)) for which the residual
has decreased by a factor of at least <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{8}" text="10 ^ 8" xml:id="S5.I2.i5.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </itemize>
        <p>The matrix <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{D}" text="widetilde@(D)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is as in (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:tilde_D"/>) where
<Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{D}_{11}=\widetilde{A}_{11}" text="(widetilde@(D)) _ 11 = (widetilde@(A)) _ 11" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This choice of <Math mode="inline" tex="\widetilde{D}" text="widetilde@(D)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> requires an
additional preconditioner for the iterative solution of linear systems with the matrix
<Math mode="inline" tex="D=R\widetilde{D}R^{T}" text="D = R * widetilde@(D) * R ^ T" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, which is part of the efficient application of the operator
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi_{\widetilde{D}}" text="Pi _ (widetilde@(D))" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The systems with <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are solved using the preconditioned conjugate
gradient (PCG) method. The stopping criterion for this inner iterative process is a
residual reduction by a factor <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{6}" text="10 ^ 6" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="6" role="NUMBER">6</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the number of PCG iterations to reach it–where
reported–is denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{i}" text="n _ i" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. A robust and uniform preconditioner <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{ILUE}" text="B _ (I * L * U * E)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
can be constructed based on incomplete factorization using exact local factorization (ILUE).
The definition of <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{ILUE}" text="B _ (I * L * U * E)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is as follows:
<!--  %**** String Line 1525 **** --></p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex1">
          <Math mode="display" tex="B_{ILUE}:=LU,\qquad U:=\sum_{i=1}^{n}R_{i}^{T}U_{i}R_{i},\qquad L:=U^{T}{\rm&#10;diag%&#10;}(U)^{-1}," text="formulae@(B _ (I * L * U * E) assign L * U, formulae@(U assign ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R _ i) ^ T * U _ i * R _ i), L assign U ^ T * diag * U ^ (- 1)))" xml:id="S5.Ex1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex1.m1.2"/>

                      <XMDual xml:id="S5.Ex1.m1.2.2">
                        <XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex1.m1.2.2.1">

                            <XMApp>

                          </XMApp>

                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>

          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex2">
          <Math mode="display" tex="D_{i}=L_{i}U_{i},\qquad D=\sum_{i=1}^{n}R_{i}^{T}D_{i}R_{i},\qquad{\rm diag}(L%&#10;_{i})=I," text="formulae@(D _ i = L _ i * U _ i, formulae@(D = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@((R _ i) ^ T * D _ i * R _ i), diag * L _ i = I))" xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="20.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                                <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="20.0pt">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">diag</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.2.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex2.m1.1.2.2.1">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>for details see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kraus2009robust" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.
Note that as <Math mode="inline" tex="D_{i}" text="D _ i" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are the local contributions to <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> related to the subdomains
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega_{i}" text="Omega _ i" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\dots,n" text="i = list@(1, dots, n)" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m20.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m20.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p2.m20.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m20.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m20.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS1.p2.m20.3">n</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, they are all non-singular.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p3">
        <p>The next two sections are devoted to the presentation of numerical results.
The experiments fall into two categories.
The first category, presented in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:sec:Hdiv"/>, serves the evaluation of the
performance of the ASMG method on linear systems arising from discretization of the
weighted <Math mode="inline" tex="H({\operatorname{div}})" text="H * div" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.SS1.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S5.SS1.p3.m1.1">div</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> bilinear form (<ref labelref="LABEL:WH-div-prod"/>). All three test cases, [a], [b],
and [c], are considered and both variants of the ASMG method, Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/>
and <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>, are compared, testing V- and W-cycle with and without smoothing.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS1.p4">
        <p>The second category of experiments, discussed in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:sec:saddle_point_sys"/>,
addresses the solution of the indefinite linear system (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>)
arising from problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>) by a preconditioned MinRes method.
The main purposes are, on the one hand, to confirm the robustness of the block-diagonal
preconditioner (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:AFW_preconditioner"/>) with respect to arbitrary multiscale
coefficient variations, and on the other hand, to demonstrate its numerical scalability.
<!--  %**** String Line 1550 **** --></p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:Hdiv" xml:id="S5.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">5.2</tag>Numerical tests for solving the system (<ref labelref="LABEL:algebraic-hdiv"/>)</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">5.2</tag>Numerical tests for solving the system (<ref labelref="LABEL:algebraic-hdiv"/>)</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS2.p1">
        <p>Here we test the ASMG preconditioner for solving the system (<ref labelref="LABEL:algebraic-hdiv"/>) with
a matrix corresponding
to the discretization
of the form <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lambda_{\alpha}({{\mathbf{u}}},{{\mathbf{v}}})" text="Lambda _ alpha * open-interval@(u, v)" xml:id="S5.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Lambda" role="UNKNOWN">Λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS2.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.SS2.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS2.p1.m1.1">u</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.SS2.p1.m1.2">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:ex:1" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 5.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 5.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 5.1</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The first set of experiments is for the test cases [a] and [b].
In Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:a_bilinear_alg1_V_m0"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:table:b_bilinear_alg1_W_m1"/> we report the
number of outer iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for the <Math mode="inline" tex="\ell" text="ell" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-level V-cycle and W-cycle ASMG method
defined by
Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/>.
The coarsest mesh is composed of <Math mode="inline" tex="4\times 4" text="4 * 4" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> squares corresponding to <Math mode="inline" tex="40" text="40" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="40" role="NUMBER">40</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> DOF
on the <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{RT}}_{{0}}}" text="R * T _ 0" xml:id="S5.Thmexample1.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> space.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>

        <toccaption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=" ">2</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [a] with <Math mode="inline" tex="K(x)=10^{q}" text="K * x = 10 ^ q" xml:id="S5.T2.m93">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.T2.m93.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.T2.m93.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and two smoothing steps (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=2" text="m = 2" xml:id="S5.T2.m94">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</toccaption>
        <caption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=". ">Table 2</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [a] with <Math mode="inline" tex="K(x)=10^{q}" text="K * x = 10 ^ q" xml:id="S5.T2.m95">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.T2.m95.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.T2.m95.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and two smoothing steps (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=2" text="m = 2" xml:id="S5.T2.m96">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</caption>
      </table>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS2.p2">
        <p>As we can see by comparing the results summarized in Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:a_bilinear_alg1_V_m0"/>
and <ref labelref="LABEL:table:a_bilinear_alg1_V_m2"/> the <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-cycle multigrid preconditioner gains robustness
with respect to the contrast of a binary distribution of a piecewise constant permeability
coefficient when increasing the number of smoothing steps from zero to two. We further observe
an increase of the number of ASMG iterations for decreasing mesh size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (in average <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-<Math mode="inline" tex="3" text="3" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
times). At the same time, as seen in Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:a_bilinear_alg1_W_m1"/>, the <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-cycle
preconditioner with one smoothing step is robust with respect to both the contrast and
the mesh size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S5.SS2.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <table inlist="lot" labels="LABEL:table:a_bilinear_alg1_W_m1" placement="h!" xml:id="S5.T3">

        <toccaption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=" ">3</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [a], one smoothing step (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=1" text="m = 1" xml:id="S5.T3.m93">

        <caption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=". ">Table 3</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [a], one smoothing step (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=1" text="m = 1" xml:id="S5.T3.m94">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</caption>
      </table>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS2.p3">
        <p>In the next set of numerical experiments we consider the same
distribution of inclusions of low permeability
as before but this time against a background of a randomly distributed piecewise constant
<!--  %**** String Line 1650 **** -->permeability coefficient as shown on Figure <ref labelref="LABEL:fig:islands_random"/>. The results, presented
in Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:b_bilinear_alg1_V_m0"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:table:b_bilinear_alg1_V_m2"/>, are even
better than those obtained for the binary distribution in the sense that here both <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.SS2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-
and <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.SS2.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-cycle are robust with respect to the contrast.</p>
      </para>

        <toccaption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=" ">5</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [b], two smoothing steps (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=2" text="m = 2" xml:id="S5.T5.m93">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</toccaption>
        <caption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=". ">Table 5</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>: case [b], two smoothing steps (<Math mode="inline" tex="m=2" text="m = 2" xml:id="S5.T5.m94">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>)</caption>
      </table>
