      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:ex:2" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 5.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 5.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 5.2</text></tag>.</title>
<!--  %**** String Line 1725 **** -->        <para xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The second set of experiments is related to the test case [c] where, similarly to
Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>, we examine the performance of the preconditioner for the bilinear
form (<ref labelref="LABEL:WH-div-prod"/>). Here we compare the ASMG preconditioners defined by
Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> and Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>. In this example the
finest mesh is always composed of <Math mode="inline" tex="256\times 256" text="256 * 256" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="256" role="NUMBER">256</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="256" role="NUMBER">256</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> elements meaning that changing
the number of levels <Math mode="inline" tex="\ell" text="ell" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> refers to a different size of the coarse-grid problem.
Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_bilinear_V"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:table:c74_bilinear_W"/> report the number
of outer iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and the maximum number of inner iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{i}" text="n _ i" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> needed
to reduce the residual of the linear systems with the matrix <Math mode="inline" tex="R\widetilde{D}R^{T}" text="R * widetilde@(D) * R ^ T" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> by a
factor of <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{6}" text="10 ^ 6" xml:id="S5.Thmexample2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="6" role="NUMBER">6</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS2.p4">
        <p>Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_bilinear_V"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_bilinear_W"/> contain the results
for SPE10 slice 44. We see that while the number of inner iterations is about the
same, the number <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.SS2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of outer iterations in case of the V-cycle is on average
<Math mode="inline" tex="2.5" text="2.5" xml:id="S5.SS2.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="2.5" role="NUMBER">2.5</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> times higher than those for the W-cycle. However, since the complexity of the V-cycle
is lower, the overall performance of these two methods is comparable. Comparing the
two algorithms, we see that they have approximately the same number of inner and outer
iterations. Due to its lower memory requirements we could therefore recommend
Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> for these kinds of problems.
On Tables <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c74_bilinear_V"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:table:c74_bilinear_W"/> we present the results
for SPE10 slice 74, which has slightly different permeability distribution but has
the same contrast, <Math mode="inline" tex="\kappa=10^{7}" text="kappa = 10 ^ 7" xml:id="S5.SS2.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="kappa" role="UNKNOWN">κ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="7" role="NUMBER">7</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Computational results are pretty much the same for
this case as well.</p>
      </para>

                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>

                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

        </tabular>
        <toccaption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=" ">11</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:2"/>: case [c] - slice 74 of SPE10 benchmark</toccaption>

    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:saddle_point_sys" xml:id="S5.SS3">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">5.3</tag>Testing of block-diagonal preconditioner for system (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>)
within MinRes iteration</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">5.3</tag>Testing of block-diagonal preconditioner for system (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>)
within MinRes iteration</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS3.p1">
        <p>Now we present a number of numerical experiments for solving the mixed finite element
system (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>) by using
a preconditioned MinRes method.
We consider two different examples, first, Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:3"/> in which the performance
of the block-diagonal preconditioner and its dependence on the accuracy of the inner
solves with W-cycle ASMG preconditioner is evaluated, and second,
Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:4"/>
that tests the scalability of the MinRes iteration, again using a W-cycle ASMG preconditioner
with one smoothing step for the inner iterations.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:ex:3" xml:id="S5.Thmexample3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 5.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 5.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 5.3</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmexample3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Here we apply the MinRes iteration to
solve (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>) for test case [c]. The hierarchy
of meshes is the same as in Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:2"/>.
An ASMG W-cycle
based on Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> with one smoothing step has been
used as a preconditioner on the <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{RT}}_{{0}}}" text="R * T _ 0" xml:id="S5.Thmexample3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
space. Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1"/> shows the number of MinRes
iterations denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{MinRes}" text="n _ (M * i * n * R * e * s)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, the
maximum number of ASMG iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> needed to achieve an
ASMG residual reduction by <Math mode="inline" tex="\varpi" text="varpi" xml:id="S5.Thmexample3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="varpi" role="UNKNOWN">ϖ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
<!--  %**** String Line 1900 **** --></text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>

                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok meaning="17" role="NUMBER">17</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>
              <td align="center" border="r"><Math mode="inline" tex="6" text="6" xml:id="S5.T13.m42">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok meaning="6" role="NUMBER">6</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>
              <td align="center"><Math mode="inline" tex="15" text="15" xml:id="S5.T13.m43">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok meaning="15" role="NUMBER">15</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>
              <td align="center"><Math mode="inline" tex="8" text="8" xml:id="S5.T13.m44">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></td>
            </tr>
          </tbody>
        </tabular>
        <toccaption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=" ">13</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:3"/>: case [c] - slice 44 of SPE10 benchmark. The hierarchy
of meshes is the same as in Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:2"/>.</toccaption>
        <caption class="ltx_centering"><tag close=". ">Table 13</tag>Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:3"/>: case [c] - slice 44 of SPE10 benchmark. The hierarchy
of meshes is the same as in Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:2"/>.</caption>
      </table>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" labels="LABEL:ex:4" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4">
        <tags>
          <tag>Example 5.4</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">5.4</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Example 5.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 5.4</text></tag>.</title>
        <para xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">In the last set of experiments the MinRes iteration has been used to
solve (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>) for test case [c] on the same hierarchy of
meshes as in Example <ref labelref="LABEL:ex:1"/>. An ASMG W-cycle based on Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> with
one smoothing step has been used as a preconditioner on the <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathcal{RT}}_{{0}}}" text="R * T _ 0" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> space for a residual
reduction by <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{8}" text="10 ^ 8" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1_m"/> shows the number of MinRes
iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{MinRes}" text="n _ (M * i * n * R * e * s)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>,
the maximum number of (inner) ASMG iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> per (outer) MinRes iteration,
and the number of DOF. Note that as long as the product <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{MinRes}n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (M * i * n * R * e * s) * n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.Thmexample4.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is constant,
the total number of arithmetic operations required to achieve any prescribed
<!--  %**** String Line 1950 **** -->accuracy is proportional to the number of DOF.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <table inlist="lot" labels="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1_m" placement="ht!" xml:id="S5.T14">

<!--  %**** String Line 1975 **** -->    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S5.SS4">
      <tags>
        <tag>5.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§5.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">5.4</tag>Some conclusions and general comments regarding the numerical experiments</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">5.4</tag>Some conclusions and general comments regarding the numerical experiments</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p1">
        <p>The presented numerical results clearly demonstrate the efficiency of the proposed algebraic
multilevel iteration (AMLI)-cycle auxiliary space multigrid (ASMG) preconditioner
for problems with highly varying
coefficients
as they typically arise in the mathematical modelling of physical processes in high-contrast
and high-frequency media.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p2">
        <p>The first group of tests examines
the convergence behavior of the nonlinear ASMG method
for the weighted bilinear
form (<ref labelref="LABEL:WH-div-prod"/>).
This is a key
point in the presented study.
The cases [a] and [b] are designed to represent a typical multiscale geometry with
islands and channels. Although case [b] (a background with a random coefficient)
appears to be more complicated, the impact of the multiscale heterogeneity seems to
be stronger in the binary case [a] where the number of iterations is slightly larger.
However, in both cases we
observe a uniformly converging
ASMG V-cycle
with <Math mode="inline" tex="m=2" text="m = 2" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and W-cycle (<Math mode="inline" tex="\nu=2" text="nu = 2" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) with <Math mode="inline" tex="m=1" text="m = 1" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Some small
fluctuations of the results
<!--  %**** String Line 2000 **** -->in the right-lower corner of the tables could be due to some round off effects.
Case [c] (SPE10) is
a popular benchmark problem in the petroleum engineering
community. Here we observe robust and uniform convergence with respect
to the number of levels <Math mode="inline" tex="\ell" text="ell" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, or, equivalently, mesh-size <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note
that such uniform convergence is present for the ASMG V-cycle even
without smoothing iterations (i.e. <Math mode="inline" tex="m=0" text="m = 0" xml:id="S5.SS4.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) and for both,
Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> and Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>. In
addition, Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/> is computationally more favorable
when compared to Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm1"/> because
the matrices used in Algorithm <ref labelref="LABEL:algorithm2"/>
have fewer non-zeroes (they are sparser).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p3">
        <p>The last two tables,
Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1_m"/>,
confirm the expected optimal convergence rate
of the block-diagonally preconditioned MinRes iteration applied
to the coupled saddle point system (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:saddle_point_sys"/>).
The results in Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1"/> demonstrate
how the efficiency (in terms of the product <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{MinRes}n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (M * i * n * R * e * s) * n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) is achieved
for a relative accuracy of <Math mode="inline" tex="10^{-8}" text="10 ^ (- 8)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="10" role="NUMBER">10</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="8" role="NUMBER">8</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the inner ASMG solver.
Table <ref labelref="LABEL:table:c44_saddle_W_m1_m"/> illustrates
the scalability of the solver
indicated by a (almost) constant number of MinRes and ASMG
iterations since the total computational work is
<!--  %**** String Line 2025 **** -->in terms of fine grid matrix vector multiplications is proportional to
the product <Math mode="inline" tex="n_{MinRes}n_{ASMG}" text="n _ (M * i * n * R * e * s) * n _ (A * S * M * G)" xml:id="S5.SS4.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.SS4.p4">
        <p>Although not in the scope of this study, we note that the proposed
auxiliary space multigrid method would be suitable for implementation
on distributed memory computer architectures.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <appendix inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:append" xml:id="A1">
    <tags>
      <tag>Appendix A</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">A</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">Appendix A</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=" ">Appendix A</tag>Discrete inf-sup condition</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">A</tag>Discrete inf-sup condition</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="A1.p1">
      <p>Here we provide a proof of the discrete inf-sup condition
(<ref labelref="LABEL:inf_sup_fin_set"/>) for the bilinear form arising in the mixed
finite element method. We begin by introducing some details regarding
the finite element spaces involved in the approximation of
problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:dual_mixed"/>) or (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:LS"/>).</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="A1.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>A.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">A.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§A.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">A.1</tag>Raviart-Thomas-Nédélec  space</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">A.1</tag>Raviart-Thomas-Nédélec  space</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p1">
        <p>We consider the standard lowest order
Raviart-Thomas-Nédélec  space <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{V}}}_{h}" text="V _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Recall that every element <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{v}}}\in{{\bm{V}}}_{h}" text="v element-of V _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be written as</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:RT" xml:id="A1.E1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(A.1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">A.1</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="{{\mathbf{v}}}=\sum_{e\in\mathcal{E}_{h}}\sigma_{e}({{\mathbf{v}}}){{\bm{\psi}%&#10;}}_{e}({{\mathbf{x}}}),\quad\sigma_{e}({{\mathbf{v}}})=\int_{e}{{\mathbf{v}}}%&#10;\cdot{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e}." text="formulae@(v = (sum _ (e element-of E _ h))@(sigma _ e * v * psi _ e * x), sigma _ e * v = (integral _ e)@(v cdot n _ e))" xml:id="A1.E1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="A1.E1.m1.4">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.4.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.4.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.E1.m1.4.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.E1.m1.4.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.E1.m1.3"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.E1.m1.3">v</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Here the vector <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e}" text="n _ e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has a fixed direction (normal to <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>), and
<!--  %**** String Line 2050 **** -->this direction is set once and for all for every
face <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in\mathcal{E}_{h}" text="e element-of E _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. For an element <Math mode="inline" tex="T\in\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T element-of T _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
let <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e,T}" text="n _ (list@(e, T))" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m7.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m7.2">T</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> define the unit normal vector to <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in\partial T\cap\mathcal{E}_{h}" text="e element-of partial-differential@(T) intersection E _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which points outward with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Now, if <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the intersection of two elements from
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{T}_{h}" text="T _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="e=T_{e}^{+}\cap T_{e}^{-}" text="e = (T _ e) ^ + intersection (T _ e) ^ -" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="T^{+}_{e}" text="(T ^ +) _ e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the element for
which <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e}\cdot{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e,T}=1" text="n _ e cdot n _ (list@(e, T)) = 1" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m14.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m14.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m14.1">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m14.2">T</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="T^{-}_{e}" text="(T ^ -) _ e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the element for which
<Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e}\cdot{{\mathbf{n}}}_{e,T}=-1" text="n _ e cdot n _ (list@(e, T)) = - 1" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m16.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="A1.SS1.p1.m16.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m16.1">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m16.2">T</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is on the boundary of the domain then the corresponding
element is <Math mode="inline" tex="T^{+}_{e}" text="(T ^ +) _ e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="T_{e}^{-}" text="(T _ e) ^ -" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is missing. Finally, for a
piece-wise constant function <Math mode="inline" tex="q\in W_{h}" text="q element-of W _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p1.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we denote</p>
        <equation xml:id="A1.Ex1">
          <Math mode="display" tex="q_{\pm,e}=q\big{|}_{T^{\pm}_{e}},\quad e\in\mathcal{E}_{h}." text="formulae@(q _ (list@(plus-or-minus, e)) = evaluated-at@(q, (T ^ plus-or-minus) _ e), e element-of E _ h)" xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="A1.Ex1.m1.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.5">

                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.5.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="A1.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP" xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.1">±</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.2">e</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                            <XMRef idref="A1.Ex1.m1.4"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.3">q</XMTok>

                            </XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.4">

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="A1.Ex1.m1.5.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="A1.SS1.p2">
        <p>The basis function <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\bm{\psi}}}_{e}\in{{\bm{V}}_{\hskip-0.569055pth}}" text="psi _ e element-of V _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" lpadding="-0.6pt" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, for <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in\mathcal{E}_{h}" text="e element-of E _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
corresponds to an edge/face <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in\partial T" text="e element-of partial-differential@(T)" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, for some <Math mode="inline" tex="T\in{\mathcal{T}}_{h}" text="T element-of T _ h" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If
<Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the face opposite to the vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{e}" text="P _ e" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the triangle/tetrahedron <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="A1.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
then</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:RT-basis" xml:id="A1.E2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(A.2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">A.2</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="{{\bm{\psi}}}_{e}\big{|}_{T}=\frac{c_{d}}{|T|}({{\mathbf{x}}}-{{\mathbf{x}}}_{%&#10;P_{e}})." text="evaluated-at@(psi _ e, T) = (c _ d / absolute-value@(T)) * (x - x _ P _ e)" xml:id="A1.E2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="A1.E2.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="A1.E2.m1.3">

                      <XMApp>

                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="A1.E2.m1.3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="bold italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
